description:
The patient encounter table contains one record for each patient encounter in your system. By default, this table does not contain Registration or PCP/Clinic Change contacts (encounter types 1 and 31). It does contain all appointments, office visits, telephone encounters, and other types of encounters. The primary key for the patient encounter table is PAT_ENC_CSN_ID.


Note that there is an index named EIX_FILT_PAT_ENC_RFL on the REFERRAL_ID column in Oracle that does not appear in the index list. The index is created by EFN_FAUX_RFL_FILT_INX.

columns.name: PAT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID assigned to the patient record. This ID may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reporting�s encryption utility.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: PCP_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider record for the patient�s General Primary Care Provider as of the date of the encounter. This ID may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reporting�s security utility.

columns.name: FIN_CLASS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value associated with the Financial Class of the encounter. Note: This item is only populated through an interface. It is not populated if you have billing system installed.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Commercial


Medicare


Medicaid


Self-Pay


Worker's Comp


Tricare


Champva


Group Health Plan


FECA Black Lung


Blue Shield


Medigap


Other


DK Regional


Client

columns.name: VISIT_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID for the visit provider associated with this encounter. In cases where there are multiple providers for one encounter, this is the ID of the first provider in the list. This item may be NULL if there is no provider for this encounter. This ID may be encrypted.

columns.name: VISIT_PROV_TITLE_NAME
columns.description:
The visit provider�s provider title (SER 5). See VISIT_PROV_ID above for the definition of visit provider. 


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: DEPARTMENT_ID
columns.description: The ID of the department for the encounter. If there are multiple departments for the encounter, this is the ID of the first department in the list.

columns.name: LMP_DATE
columns.description: The date of the patient�s Last Menstrual Period. Only contains data for encounters with female patients.

columns.name: ENC_CLOSED_YN
columns.description:
A flag that signifies if this encounter is closed as of the time of the enterprise reporting extract. This column will have the value Y, N or null. Null indicates that closing the encounter does not apply, such as a future appointment.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: ENC_CLOSED_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the system user who closed the patient encounter. This ID may be encrypted.

columns.name: ENC_CLOSE_DATE
columns.description: The date on which the patient encounter was closed.

columns.name: LOS_MODIFIER1_ID
columns.description: The first Level of Service modifier applied to the encounter. This item will appear empty if no modifier is present.

columns.name: LOS_MODIFIER1_ID_MODIFIER_NAME
columns.description: The name of the modifier record.

columns.name: LOS_MODIFIER2_ID
columns.description: The second Level of Service modifier applied to the encounter. This item will appear empty if no modifier is present.

columns.name: LOS_MODIFIER2_ID_MODIFIER_NAME
columns.description: The name of the modifier record.

columns.name: LOS_MODIFIER3_ID
columns.description: The third Level of Service modifier applied to the encounter. This item will appear empty if no modifier is present.

columns.name: LOS_MODIFIER3_ID_MODIFIER_NAME
columns.description: The name of the modifier record.

columns.name: LOS_MODIFIER4_ID
columns.description: The fourth Level of Service modifier applied to the encounter. This item will appear empty if no modifier is present.

columns.name: LOS_MODIFIER4_ID_MODIFIER_NAME
columns.description: The name of the modifier record.

columns.name: APPT_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value associated with the appointment status of the encounter as of the most recent enterprise reporting extract, such as 1 � Scheduled, 2 � Completed, 3 � Canceled, etc.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Scheduled


Completed


Canceled


No Show


Left without seen


Arrived

columns.name: APPT_CANC_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who canceled the appointment.

columns.name: CHECKIN_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the system user who checked in the patient for this encounter. If the encounter has not been through the Check In process this field will be NULL. This ID may be encrypted.

columns.name: HOSP_ADMSN_TIME
columns.description: The date and time that the patient was first admitted to the facility, bedded in the ED, or confirmed for an HOV for this contact, regardless of patient's base patient class.

columns.name: HOSP_DISCHRG_TIME
columns.description: The hospital discharge date and time for this patient contact.

columns.name: HOSP_ADMSN_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value for the type of admission for this encounter.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: NONCVRED_SERVICE_YN
columns.description:
A flag used to indicate whether the appointment is scheduled in a service not covered by the patient's coverage benefits. The flag is set to "Y" when the service is not covered and an "N" when it is covered.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: REFERRAL_REQ_YN
columns.description:
A flag used to indicate whether an appointment requires a referral as determined by the visit coverage. This flag is set to �Y� when the appointment requires a referral. If the appointment does not require a referral, it is set to �N."


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NONCVRED_SERVICE_YN

columns.name: REFERRAL_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the referral record linked to this appointment.

columns.name: ACCOUNT_ID
columns.description: The ID number of the guarantor account assigned to the visit at the time it is scheduled or when it is checked in. This ID may be encrypted.

columns.name: COVERAGE_ID
columns.description: The ID number of the coverage record assigned to the visit at the time it is scheduled or when it is checked in. This ID may be encrypted.

columns.name: CLAIM_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the billing system Claim record (CLM record) linked to charges associated with this visit.

columns.name: PRIMARY_LOC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the patient�s primary location as of the contact date of the encounter. Note: This may not be the same as the patient�s current primary location.

columns.name: CHARGE_SLIP_NUMBER
columns.description: The encounter form number or charge slip number assigned to this encounter. Note: The charge slip number is also stored in the financial table CLARITY_TDL. You can use this field to link to CLARITY_TDL to identify financial transactions associated with the encounter.

columns.name: COPAY_DUE
columns.description: The dollar amount shown in the Copay Due field of the scheduling system's Check In Patient activity. This amount may be calculated by the system using the patient's coverage benefit information or be manually entered by a user. This field may also be empty if no copay amount was entered when the patient's appointment was checked in.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: The time this patient encounter was pulled into enterprise reporting.

columns.name: HSP_ACCOUNT_ID
columns.description: The ID number of the hospital billing account assigned to the encounter.

columns.name: ADM_FOR_SURG_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the patient is being admitted for surgery.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: SURGICAL_SVC_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value corresponding to the surgical service for this patient contact.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: INPATIENT_DATA_ID
columns.description: The ID number of the record used to determine how inpatient data is stored for the encounter.

columns.name: IP_EPISODE_ID
columns.description: The ID number of the inpatient episode of care. This includes discharges from the ED.

columns.name: EXTERNAL_VISIT_ID
columns.description: The ID for the contact as assigned by a non-system. Usually populated by an interface.

columns.name: CONTACT_COMMENT
columns.description: Comments entered by the provider for the contact.

columns.name: OUTGOING_CALL_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether a call associated with a telephone encounter was initiated by the patient or by the clinic / hospital. A "Y" indicates an outgoing call placed by the clinic / hospital while an "N" indicates and incoming call from the patient.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: ENC_CLOSED_YN

columns.name: DATA_ENTRY_PERSON
columns.description: This is the name of the user who created the encounter.

columns.name: REFERRAL_SOURCE_ID
columns.description: The referral ID number of the referring physician. This physician may be from an external organization.

columns.name: REFERRAL_SOURCE_ID_REFERRING_PROV_NAM
columns.description: The name of the referral source.

columns.name: WC_TPL_VISIT_C_NAME
columns.description:
A field used to indicate whether the patient's contact is related to workers compensation or third party liability situation.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: CONSENT_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item describes the type of consent that was filed for a given encounter. It is a single-response customer-defined category.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: BMI
columns.description: This is the patient's Body Mass Index, which is calculated based on the recorded height and weight.

columns.name: BSA
columns.description: This is the patient's Body Surface Area, which is calculated based on the recorded height and weight.

columns.name: AVS_PRINT_TM
columns.description: The instant that the After Visit Summary (AVS) was printed for this encounter.

columns.name: AVS_FIRST_USER_ID
columns.description: Unique ID of the user who first prints out the After Visit Summary (AVS) for the encounter.

columns.name: ENC_MED_FRZ_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
The encounter medication freeze reason's category value.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Dirty flag


Mark Taking


New Order


Change or Reorder


Review Meds


Enter Vital Sign


Discontinue Med


Patient Arrival


Medication Refused


Close Encounter


End of Day


Mark Long-Term


Create CAM

columns.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE_DT
columns.description: The date of the encounter. The returned date is handled differently depending on the contact type of the encounter: If it is a surgery encounter, the date of the surgery will be returned. If it is a Hospital encounter, Admission/Discharge/Transfer (ADT) info will be used to return an appropriate date. If ADT info cannot be found, then the  Hospital Admission date (I EPT 18850) will be returned. If the Hospital Admission Date cannot be found, the temporary admission date (I EPT 18846) will be returned..

columns.name: DISCHARGE_DATE_DT
columns.description: The discharge date for the encounter.

columns.name: COPAY_PD_THRU_NAME
columns.description:
The method by which the copay for an appointment was paid (e.g., via MyChart, a kiosk).


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Mychart


Welcome

columns.name: INTERPRETER_NEED_YN
columns.description:
A flag used to indicate whether a patient requires an interpreter for an encounter.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: VST_SPECIAL_NEEDS_C_NAME
columns.description:
This field captures any special needs for a visit.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: BEN_ENG_SP_AMT
columns.description: Stores the adjudicated self-pay amount (the amount required to be paid by the patient) when determining the copay amount for the visit.

columns.name: BEN_ADJ_COPAY_AMT
columns.description: Stores the adjudicated copy amount for the visit according to the patient's coverage benefits.

columns.name: BEN_ADJ_METHOD_C_NAME
columns.description:
Flag to indicate if and how the adjudicated copay was overridden


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Benefit Package Adjudication Formula


Coverage Level Override


Plan Level Override


Copay Suppressed


Payor Level Override Programming Point


Service Area Level Override Programming Point


Waived - Secondary Coverage Available


Copay Computation Function Programming Point

columns.name: ENC_CREATE_USER_ID
columns.description: The ID number of the user who create the patient or encounter record.

columns.name: ENC_INSTANT
columns.description: The instant an encounter was created

columns.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE_DTTM
columns.description: The start date and time of an encounter. The start date is pulled from the date stored in the EFFECTIVE_DATE_DT column. The time references the first populated time in the following fields: hospital admission time (EPT 18851), hospital temporary admission time (EPT 18847), ADT arrival time (EPT 10815), and expected admission time (EPT 10300).  The SlicerDicer reporting application uses this column to determine the EffectiveStartDate of encounters.

columns.name: CALCULATED_ENC_STAT_C_NAME
columns.description:
A status flag used to  determine whether to include data from the encounter in the SlicerDicer reporting application. Statuses includes 1-Possible (e.g., the encounter is a scheduled outpatient appointment or the admission is pending) or 2-Complete (e.g., the appointment is complete, the admission is discharged).


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Possible


Complete


Invalid


In Progress
